[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_map()] [Cost Validation] Does the high cost (n * 1210 + 3314) account for the mapped function's cost, or just iteration overhead? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_pow()] [Critical Underpricing] Fixed cost u170 for exponentiation is dangerous - can attacker compute 2^1000000 for nearly free? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_if()] [Bypass Risk] Fixed cost u200 ignores branch content - can attacker nest expensive operations in if branches to bypass cost accounting? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_analysis_visit()] [Cost Bypass] Fixed cost u1 for visit is essentially free - what prevents abuse of repeated visits? (High)
[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_analysis_storage()] [I/O Overflow] Can write_length overflow when (n * 1 + 1) exceeds storage limits? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_create_map()] [I/O Overflow] Can write_length (n * 1 + 1) underestimate actual storage for maps with complex keys/values? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_set_entry()] [I/O Mismatch] Why is read_length u0 when read_count is u1 - does this correctly model read operations? (Medium)
[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_set_var()] [I/O Mismatch] Similarly, read_length u0 with read_count u1 - is this a bug or intentional? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Consensus Split] If testnet costs differ from mainnet costs, can this cause cross-network replay or consensus issues? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Cost Estimation] Are these costs empirically derived from real execution, or theoretical estimates that may not match reality? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_contract_call()] [Fixed Cost Risk] Is u153 sufficient for contract calls which may involve expensive cross-contract state access? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_contract_of()] [Fixed Cost Risk] Why is contract-of so expensive at u13400 - does this prevent legitimate use cases? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_principal_of()] [Fixed Cost Risk] Is u39 sufficient for principal-of which may require cryptographic operations? (Low)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Cost Gaming] Can sophisticated attackers analyze cost ratios to find operations that provide maximum computation for minimum fee? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Batch Optimization] Can attackers batch underpriced operations to amplify DoS impact beyond individual operation costs? (High)
[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: logn()] [Division by Zero] What happens if log2 is called with n=1 - does it return 0 safely or cause issues? (Low)
[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: nlogn()] [Degenerate Case] For n=1, nlogn returns (a * 1 * 0 + b) = b - is this the intended minimum cost? (Low)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Negative Costs] Can any formula produce negative costs through overflow, causing free or refunded execution? (Critical)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_stx_transfer()] [State Consistency] Does single write_count u1 correctly handle atomic sender debit and receiver credit? (High)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_ft_transfer()] [State Consistency] With write_count u2, are both sender and receiver updates properly accounted? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_ft_mint()] [Supply Tracking] Does write_count u2 correctly account for supply increment and recipient balance update? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Parameter Meaning] Does the parameter 'n' consistently represent the same thing (size, depth, count) across all functions? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Scale Validation] Are the coefficient values (a in linear formulas) appropriate for the units used in runtime cost accounting? (Medium)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: Multiple] [Constant Validation] Are the constant terms (b in formulas) derived from fixed overhead costs or arbitrary? (Low)

[File: stackslib/src/chainstate/stacks/boot/costs-2-testnet.clar] [Function: cost_analysis_lookup_variable_depth()] [Unbounded Recursion] Does nlogn cost prevent stack overflow from extremely deep variable lookup chains? (High)
